item.title: CEX-IO Bitcoin Exchange Launches Ethereum Trading
item.description:
CEX-IO Bitcoin Exchange Launches Ethereum Trading

Bitcoin Press Release: CEX.IO Bitcoin exchange launched trading Ethers, currency used by the Ethereum decentralised platform that runs smart contracts. CEX.IO users are now able to buy and sell ETH for Bitcoins and US Dollars. April 13th, 2016, - Following trends, CEX.IO has expanded the range of currencies traded on the exchange with ETH/BTC and ETH/USD.

item.title: The Push for a Cashless Society Could Be an Opportunity for Bitcoin
item.description:
The Push for a Cashless Society Could Be an Opportunity for Bitcoin

The idea of a cashless society has long been touted by government and bank officials around the world for a variety of regulatory, financial and political reasons. For one, a cashless society would give governments and banks more power over people's money. For example, the concept of negative interest rates falls apart if everyone is holding physical cash.

item.title: Bitcoin Scalability: An Inside Look at Lightning's Race to Save the Day
item.description:
Bitcoin Scalability: An Inside Look at Lightning's Race to Save the Day

With the halving looming and transaction capacity maxed out, some are predicting a doomsday scenario. Much, therefore, depends on the Lightning Network. A "decentralized network using smart contract functionality in the blockchain to enable instant payments" which is capable of an amazing "millions to billions of transactions per second" according to the Lightning Network's website.

item.title: Bitcoin In The Time Of Negative Interest Rates
item.description:
Bitcoin In The Time Of Negative Interest Rates

The Central Banks of Japan and Europe have imposed negative interest rates on deposits. Would these blunt monetary tools of Central Bankers be effective if bitcoin adoption becomes widespread? Christine Lagarde, International Monetary Fund Managing Director, says: "We see the recent introduction of negative interest rates by the ECB and Bank of Japan as net positives in current circumstances, though not without side effects that warrant vigilance."

item.title: PUSHDATA4 unnecessary?
item.description:
PUSHDATA4 unnecessary?

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. It's 100% free, no registration required. Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top Any data push greater than 520 bytes in a Bitcoin transaction is not allowed ( https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/v0.10.0rc3/src/script/script.h#L18).

item.title: Peter Todd Worried About Those Willing to 'Fork Bitcoin at All Costs'
item.description:
Peter Todd Worried About Those Willing to 'Fork Bitcoin at All Costs'

Bitcoin Core contributor Peter Todd recently discussed a variety of topics on The Crypto Show . Todd was asked if he is still worried about the possibly negative implications of a controversial hard fork induced by Bitcoin Classic or any other alternative Bitcoin client.

item.title: SAFE Crossroads Podcast #31, Harmen Klink
item.description:
SAFE Crossroads Podcast #31, Harmen Klink

In this Episode We're back again with Harmen Klink, talking about further innovations on the Decorum decentralized forum and social connection protocol. We talk about a web of trust function which will make the protocol very handy at evaluating one's connections and resisting unwanted connections.

item.title: What hardware and bandwidth requirements would a server need to fulfill to run Bitcore?
item.description:
What hardware and bandwidth requirements would a server need to fulfill to run Bitcore?

What's the cost of running Bitcore on AWS or DigitalOcean? I know I'd need about 128gb of hardrive space, but I'm not sure how much the typical bandwidth costs would be, and how much RAM or cores I...

item.title: Kraken Gains Series B Investment, Pushes Bitcoin Services & Ethereum in Japan
item.description:
Kraken Gains Series B Investment, Pushes Bitcoin Services & Ethereum in Japan

One of the largest bitcoin and cryptocurrency exchanges in the world, Kraken, has announced an investment from a leading Japanese foreign exchange brokerage, in the exchange's Series B round of financing. Cryptocurrency exchange Kraken has announced an investment from Tokyo-based Money Partners Group as a part of its Series B round of financing, in a press release today.

item.title: About 1 year ago I decided I wanted to do something to help Bitcoin but I lack sufficient coding skills. So I did something else and tomorrow I teach my first class on Bitcoin and Cryptocurrencies at my local community college. * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:
About 1 year ago I decided I wanted to do something to help Bitcoin but I lack sufficient coding skills. So I did something else and tomorrow I teach my first class on Bitcoin and Cryptocurrencies at my local community college. * /r/Bitcoin

A few years ago I finally decided to look up that work 'bitcoin' that had popped up on my reddit front page from time to time. About 6 months of...
